intro: Leptogramma mollissima f. pilosissima, commonly known as the silky fern, is a variant of the silky maidenhair fern, characterized by its finely textured, soft fronds. It is a member of the family Blechnaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves with a silky, velvety texture that gives it its common name. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique foliage makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and botanical collections.
